title: Inclusive Mathematics Education Design: Focusing on Universal Design and Critical Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: A mathematics instruction competency enhancement course for in-service elementary school teachers, emphasizing educational design capabilities to address diverse learner needs in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can design math instructional materials (digital/print) accessible to all students by applying universal design principles.
Learners can analyze cultural biases in math education and propose improvements using a critical librarianship framework.
Learners can contribute to closing learning gaps by designing inclusive formative assessment tools.

resources: DEI (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion) Casebook in Mathematics Education

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
